Required Documents, Terms, and Condition: Required Documents, Terms, and Conditions for Buying an Apartment:
Preliminary sales contract between the p: Preliminary sales contract between the parties
Real estate tax certificate if the prope: Real estate tax certificate if the property is old
Building permit if the property is new,: Building permit if the property is new, and there are procedures to be followed through the Real Estate Authority, such as issuing a determination statement or a change form, and paying the fees, etc.
Full name of the buyer and seller - ID n: Full name of the buyer and seller - ID number (preferably each party obtains a copy of the other's ID) - Full residential address
Detailed description of the property bei: Detailed description of the property being sold (whether it's an apartment, vacant land, shop, or complete property), with precise area measurement (the contract will be rejected by the Real Estate Authority in case of any shortage or excess in the area written in the contract, exceeding 10%)
Full details of the sale, according to t: Full details of the sale, according to the property number in the neighborhood, street name, andregion,as well as the address of the property and the province, then a statement about the plot ofland, including the plot number, square, and basin, based on the spatial data
Clear statement of the price and the pay: Clear statement of the price and the payment method.
Explanation of how the seller owns the p: Explanation of how the seller owns the property or the apartment being sold, including all consecutive contracts for the property (in case of heirs, mention the number and date of declaring inheritance to reach the number of the registered contract and the court that issued it). In addition, the buyer must receive all previous ownership contracts from the seller (in case of purchasing an apartment or a shop from the owner of a building or tower and due to the difficulty of delivering those documents, as the owner sells to others, copies of all sales contracts for the land of the property must be obtained from the owner, and the owner must sign each page of the copies indicating that they are true copies of the contract).
Mention the building permit number and d: Mention the building permit number and date in case of selling apartments and shops.
There must be an explicit clause that th: There must be an explicit clause that the owner guarantees hidden defects fully, and acknowledges responsibility in case of any hidden defect in the property, whether it is material or legal. This is in addition to the other usual clauses of guaranteeing the absence of any financial obligations on the property to the state, such as taxes, water, or electricity, prior to the date of the sales contract.
Required Documents, Conditions, and Term: Required Documents, Conditions, and Terms for Buying a Property:
The registered ownership document (known: The registered ownership document (known as the 'Green Contract') is the best proof of ownership and contains a month and date stamp. It can be obtained from the Real Estate Registration Authority by anyone, even if they are not a party to the contract, for a fee.
The unregistered sales contract is the ': The unregistered sales contract is the 'initial contract' signed between the parties and sealed with the eagle seal, indicated by the phrase 'considered in lawsuit number X'. This means that a judgment has been issued on the validity of the seller's signature on this contract, and there must be a sealed judgment containing this text, stating that the court has ruled on the validity of the defendant's signature on the sales contract dated X. This seal does not mean that the unit is registered, and it is not a declaration of the unit's registration, but it is widely used by everyone due to its low cost.
Note: There is a common misunderstanding: Note: There is a common misunderstanding among people regarding the difference between the initial and final contracts. Both can be referred to as 'initial contracts.' The only true final contract is the registered Green Contract.
The fifth step is to inquire with the di: The fifth step is to inquire with the district responsible for the property and the unit's owner about the unit's status and services, such as whether it has a building permit or if it is in violation. If the services have not yet been connected, such as electricity, there may be a problem connecting them to the apartment.
Sixth, after inquiring about the propert: Sixth, after inquiring about the property in the district, inquire about all the services available in the unit, such as electricity, water, gas, and central services, by reviewing previous receipts. Ensure that the unit's owner has contracted for these services and has paid for them until the last date to purchase the unit.
In conclusion, buying a property require: In conclusion, buying a property requires obtaining the necessary documents, verifying their validity, checking the property's status and services, and ensuring that the seller is legally authorized to sell the property. Additionally, the payment method must be agreed upon and documented in the sales contract, and all taxes and fees related to the favourite must be paid.
Seventh, the registered ownership docume: Seventh, the registered ownership document (known as 'the Green Contract') is checked. In this case, there is an assumption that the contract is valid. The Green Contract should be taken to the Real Estate Registration Authority, where it will be stamped for a fee and returned with the date and month of registration. A copy of the contract should be obtained and presented to the authority to confirm its validity. The piece of land, boundaries, and area of the unit must be specified in the contract.
The unregistered sales contract, which i: The unregistered sales contract, which is the initial contract signed between the parties and sealed with the eagle seal and indicated by the phrase 'considered in lawsuit number X'. This means that a judgment has been issued on the validity of the seller's signature on this contract, and there must be a sealed judgment containing this text, stating that the court has ruled on the validity of the defendant's signature on the sales contract dated X. This does not mean that the unit is registered, and this seal is not a declaration of the unit's registration, but it is widely used by everyone due to its low cost.
Eighth, after completing all the necessa: Eighth, after completing all the necessary inquiries and verifying the validity of the ownership document and building permits for the property and the unit, the sales contract is written. It should include the ownership sequence, the seller's guarantee of possessing the unit, and his guarantee of any latent defects. The boundaries of the property and unit should also be mentioned. A clause should be included in which the seller agrees to issue a power of attorney to the buyer for selling to himself or others and dealing with all government and non-government entities.
Ninth and finally, after signing the con: Ninth and finally, after signing the contracts, both parties should go to the Real Estate Registration Authority to issue a power of attorney from the seller to the buyer, as previously explained. This power of attorney allows the buyer to handle any government favourites (electricity, water, gas, telephone, etc.) in his name, relieving the seller of any further obligations.
In conclusion, buying a property require: In conclusion, buying a property requires several procedures, including obtaining the necessary documents, checking their validity, verifying the unit's status and services, and ensuring that the seller is legally authorized to sell the property. Additionally, the payment method must be agreed upon and documented in the sales contract, and all taxes and fees related to the favourite must be paid.
The unregistered sales contract is consi: The unregistered sales contract is considered a valid contract, and it does not prevent the sale from being valid.
Both registered and unregistered contrac: Both registered and unregistered contracts are considered valid.
The buyer has the right to demand delive: The buyer has the right to demand delivery of the property and request it to be placed under custody if there are concerns about the property's safety.
The buyer has legal ownership of the pro: The buyer has legal ownership of the property and can file lawsuits related to it, including eviction of the seller from the property and requesting its delivery to the buyer.
The buyer has the right to object to the: The buyer has the right to object to the sale of the property to a tenant by the seller before registering the contract, and the seller cannot lease the property to the buyer despite being the owner until the registration is complete. However, if the seller has not yet delivered the property to the tenant, the buyer can request its delivery.
The buyer has ownership rights to any cr: The buyer has ownership rights to any crops or fruits produced by the property.
In the case of an unregistered contract,: In the case of an unregistered contract, the buyer has the right to demand the seller to deliver any crops produced by the property.
The buyer has ownership rights to the re: The buyer has ownership rights to the registered property, while the unregistered contract transfers all rights and lawsuits related to the sale to the buyer. The buyer can receive the property and evict any intruders, but ownership rights are not transferred.
Before registration, the buyer is only a: Before registration, the buyer is only a regular debtor to the seller and has no direct relationship with the tenant. The buyer's relationship with the seller ends when the registration is complete.
If the seller (old owner) transfers the: If the seller (old owner) transfers the lease contract to the buyer (new owner) before the registration, the buyer can demand the tenant's rights, including rent, without the need for the old owner's involvement.
The buyer has the right to benefit from: The buyer has the right to benefit from the property and all rights related to it, and can replace the seller in these rights before other partners in the property. This includes the right to enjoy what the seller had before the sale, and to benefit from it in proportion to the buyer's share in the property.
The deposit is the amount that one of th: The deposit is the amount that one of the contractors provides to the other when creating the contract, and the contractors may agree to make their contract binding and final or allow each of them the right to sign or cancel the contract. This is determined solely by the intention of the contractors or the value of the compensation agreed upon in case of contract termination due to one of the contractors' failure to fulfill their obligations or the value of the deposit. The deposit may be the amount paid by the buyer to the seller under the sales contract, which the buyer will lose if the sale is not completed, or it may be part of the price that is not subject to the seller's jurisdiction as compensation if the buyer cancels the contract due to their mistake and causes harm to the seller. The buyer's cancellation may be due to a hidden defect in the property sold.
If the sales contract includes a conditi: If the sales contract includes a condition in which the seller prohibits the buyer from disposing of the property until the seller's death, and the seller retains the right to benefit from it throughout their life as a guarantee of their right, this does not prevent the favourite from being considered a valid sale contract for ownership. This condition does not mean that the sale is only a will.
The seller may issue a sales contract in: The seller may issue a sales contract in the form of a gift contract for his children, and it is considered a valid contract as long as the favourite is not subject to any additional conditions after the seller's death. If the contract is executed during the seller's lifetime, who has waived his rights to the property under this contract, and the contract is in the possession of the administrator who has taken the necessary registration procedures or submitted it to the court to obtain the validity of the seller's signature, then the contract is valid and effective.
The buyer must verify the seller's ident: The buyer must verify the seller's identity, description, and whether they are an authorized representative or agent of a company by reviewing official documents and keeping a copy.
The buyer must confirm the validity and: The buyer must confirm the validity and duration of the authorization by sending a recent official copy of it.
The buyer must review and confirm the va: The buyer must review and confirm the validity of the seller's property title by obtaining a recent official copy.
The buyer must obtain a negative certifi: The buyer must obtain a negative certificate regarding any property favourites related to the land.
The buyer should seek assistance from th: The buyer should seek assistance from the survey and real estate registration departments to obtain an approved land division.
The buyer should consult the engineering: The buyer should consult the engineering departments in the neighborhoods or city councils to confirm whether the land is suitable for construction or not.
The buyer should avoid purchasing land o: The buyer should avoid purchasing land owned by government entities such as housing ministry or city agencies.
If the seller's property title is regist: If the seller's property title is registered with the real estate registry or the land register, the buyer must check the ownership sequence of the seller until the last registered contract. If the ownership is not registered, the buyer should investigate the possibility of registering it. There is a risk of invalidating any contract in the ownership sequence, including the seller's contract, if it is not registered.
